title: Developer snaps up Coles' unused site at Gardenvale
text:
JLL's Daniel Kelly and Nick Reddish negotiated the deal for a private vendor and are now leasing the property.

Seven Hills sale

A 1200sq m multi-use commercial property in Seven Hills, Sydney, has sold for $3.6 million at auction.

Owner-occupier Rominoff bought 16 Tucks Road, which has a 65sq m showroom, an 895sq m warehouse, a 240sq m office space, two roller doors and 18 parking spaces.

Bawdens Industrial's Graeme Scott and Taylor Nicholas' John Fabian managed the sale for private owner Quadrex.

Greenacre goes

A private business has purchased the 450sq m office/warehouse at 4 Reservoir Avenue in Greenacre in Sydney's southwest for $1.55 million to use for the distribution of its building and construction products.

Colliers International's Phillip Bradac sold the property with a crane for private investor J & C Corporation.

Advertisement

Antique hunting

A Melbourne antique dealer has bought a Prahran shopfront at auction for $1.76 million.

The two-storey 226sq m property at 533 High Street has a ground floor retail space and storage area, and two rooms on the first floor.

It is leased to Jean Pierre Heurteau Design for $74,484 a year. The purchaser will move into the property when the lease expires in February.

Teska Carson's Matthew Feld closed the deal on a passing yield of 4.2 per cent.

The antique dealer who bought this High Street shop for $1.76 million will move in next year. Supplied

Triple treat

A retail portfolio leased to three tenants on the ground floor of a residential tower in Brisbane's Riverside West End has sold for $1.85 million.

Advertisement

The 232sq m property at 28 Duncan Street is fully leased with a three-year weighted average lease expiry and sold on a net initial yield of 7.6 per cent.

JLL's Andrew Havig and Sam Byrne marketed the property.

Chemical reaction

Chemical manufacturer Marchem has bought a corner site warehouse in Tottenham, Melbourne, for $2.4 million.

The 3214sq m property at 5-7 Alick Road has driveway access and multiple roller doors.

CBRE's Tom Murphy and Ricardo Cappelletti and Greg Hocking's Nick Ott and Kellie Grant were involved.

Caffeine hit

Retailer The Coffee Machine Warehouse has bought a newly renovated showroom and warehouse in Clayton, Melbourne, from developer Wolfstep Projects for $2.05 million.

Advertisement

The retailer will use the property at 1858 Princes Highway for its business. It has six parking spaces.

CBRE’s Bryce Pane, Sandra Ng and Chao Zhang sold the property before auction.

The Coffee Machine Warehouse bought this showroom for $2.05 million from developer Wolfstep Projects. Supplied

Child's play

A childcare property developer has bought a residential site in Melbourne's Glen Waverley for $2.25 million with plans to build a 113-place childcare centre.

Savills' Julian Heatherich, Benson Zhou and Mark Stafford sold 680-682 Highbury Road.

With Su-Lin Tan

Submissions to stan@afr.com
description: In other deals, developer G.M Property Group has paid $4.1 million for an industrial property in Mulgrave.
